intro: Matelea harlingii, commonly known as the Harling's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and related species. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or reddish in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. Matelea harlingii is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
